docs.title: Adding buttons
docs.text:
In order to render a link as a button, suffix it with curly braces and add the .md-button class selector to it. The button will receive the selected [primary color] and [accent color] if active.

Button
[Subscribe to our newsletter](#){ .md-button }

[Subscribe to our newsletter][demo]{ .md-button }

[Subscribe to our newsletter][demo]{ .md-button .md-button--primary }

Prerequisites
  • Install Java Development Kit (JDK) 8+

Use java reference documentation targetting your operating system to install a Java Development Kit. You can then validate your installation with the following command.

java --version
  • Install Apache Maven (3.8+)

Samples and tutorials have been designed with Apache Maven. Use the reference documentation top install maven validate your installation with 

mvn -version

docs.title: ❓ Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)
docs.text: Welcome to the FAQ section! Below you'll find answers to the most common questions about using Good Bards.

docs.title: How do I reset my password?
docs.text: Go to the login page and click "Forgot password?". You'll receive an email with instructions to reset it.

docs.title: Can I use Good Bards for free?
docs.text: We offer a free trial with access to core features. After the trial, you can choose a plan that fits your needs.

docs.title: Can I invite team members?
docs.text: Yes! Go to Settings > Team Members and send an invite via email. You can assign roles and permissions per member.

docs.title: What kind of assets can I upload?
docs.text: We support images (PNG, JPG), videos (MP4), documents (PDF, DOCX), and more. Max file size is 200MB.

docs.title: Does Good Bards help generate content with AI?
docs.text: Yes! Our AI assistant helps you brainstorm, rewrite, translate, and improve your marketing content in real time.

docs.title: Can I publish to multiple platforms at once?
docs.text: Absolutely. Good Bards supports cross-channel publishing to social media, email, and your CMS (depending on your plan).

docs.title: 🤖 AI Agents
docs.text: Good Bards AI Agents are purpose-built assistants designed to streamline your marketing workflow — from content generation to asset optimization.

docs.title: 🧠 What Are AI Agents?
docs.text:
AI Agents are modular tools with specialized skills. Think of them as your virtual marketing collaborators, available 24/7.

Each agent is tailored to perform specific tasks such as: - ✍️ Copywriting - 🪄 Content rewriting & tone adjustment - 🌍 Translation - 🎯 Target audience adaptation - 📊 Performance suggestions

docs.title: ⚙️ Available Agents
docs.text:
Here are the default agents available in your workspace:

Agent Name Description ✍️ Copywriter Generates headlines, product descriptions, and CTAs 🧹 Rewriter Improv

docs.title: 🔌 Connectors
docs.text: Good Bards Connectors allow you to integrate your workspace with external tools and platforms — so your assets, campaigns, and workflows stay in sync across your stack.

docs.title: 🌐 What Are Connectors?
docs.text:
Connectors are integrations between Good Bards and third-party platforms. They allow you to:

  • 📁 Import files from cloud storage
  • 📤 Publish directly to social media or CMS
  • 📊 Sync campaign data with analytics tools
  • 🔔 Trigger workflows in CRMs or automation platforms

docs.title: 🔗 Available Connectors
docs.text: Platform Type Use Case Google Drive File Import Upload assets and docs directly Dropbox File Import Sync branded content from shared folders Facebook / Meta Publishing Post visuals and captions to company pages LinkedIn Publishing Distribute B2B campaigns Instagram Publishing Share assets as posts or reels HubSpot / Salesforce Automation Sync campaign leads or performance events

docs.title: 📄 Document Management
docs.text: Manage all your marketing documents — from product one-pagers to campaign briefs — directly inside Good Bards.

docs.title: 🗂️ What Can You Store?
docs.text:
You can upload and manage a wide variety of document types: - ✅ PDFs - ✅ Word Docs (DOCX) - ✅ Google Docs (linked) - ✅ Text files and markdown notes

These documents are stored securely and can be organized into folders or linked to campaigns.

docs.title: 📥 Uploading Documents
docs.text:
1. Navigate to Documents > Upload
  2. Drag and drop files or use the file picker
  3. Assign a folder, campaign, and add optional tags
  4. Click Upload to save

Organize with folders & tags

Use folders like /Brand/Guidelines or /Product/Launches to keep your library clean.

docs.title: ✏️ Editing & Versioning
docs.text:
• You can preview documents in-app (PDF, DOCX)
  • Add comments for team discussion
  • Replace or update files — all versions are saved in the version history

Auto-versioning

Every time you replace a file, Good Bards keeps the previous one accessible for rollback or audit.

docs.title: 🔍 Searching & Filtering
docs.text: Use the search bar to: - Find documents by title - Filter by tags, type, or last modified - Sort by recent, name, or folder

docs.title: 🔗 Linking to Campaigns
docs.text:
Documents can be linked directly to marketing campaigns or assets for better traceability: - Briefs - Strategy docs - Approvals - Creative references

Go to the document detail page and click "Link to

docs.title: 📢 Marketing Campaigns
docs.text: Good Bards helps you easily plan, create, and distribute marketing campaigns with AI assistance and multi-channel publishing.

docs.title: 🎯 What is a Campaign?
docs.text:
A campaign is a container for all the assets, content, and metadata related to a specific marketing initiative — like a product launch, email series, or seasonal promotion.

Each campaign may include: - ✅ Text content (ad copy, email body, product descriptions) - 🎨 Visuals (banners, logos, social media graphics) - 📅 Scheduling and publishing settings - 👥 Collaboration and approvals

docs.title: Step-by-step
docs.text:
1. Go to Campaigns > New Campaign
  2. Enter basic info: campaign name, goal, and channels
  3. Add content:
  4. Upload or create new assets
  5. Use the AI assistant to generate or rewrite content
  6. Define channels:
  7. Select where to publish (e.g. Instagram, Newsletter, Landing Page)
  8. Set schedule:
  9. Choose publish dates or save as draft
  10. Collaborate:
  11. Assign roles, request feedback, or send for approval

docs.title: 🧠 Using AI in Campaigns
docs.text:
AI Tip

Use /rewrite or /summarize in the content editor to improve messaging before publishing.

You can also: - Translate content for different markets - Generate headline variations - Get tone/style suggestions

docs.title: 📊 Tracking Campaign Performance
docs.text:
Once published, access the Analytics tab to monitor: - Views - Engagement - Conversion metrics (if integrated) - Channel-specific stats

Export reports or share insights with your team.

docs.title: 🧩 Best Practices
docs.text:
• Name clearly: Use consistent naming like Q4-2025-Halloween-Email
  • Use folders: Keep campaigns organized per product/quarter
  • Repurpose: Clone old campaigns for faster turnaround
  • Collaborate early: Get input from design, content, and management early on

docs.title: 📣 Social Media Integration
docs.text: Good Bards lets you plan, create, and publish content directly to your social media platforms — all from one place.

docs.title: 📲 Supported Platforms
docs.text:
Platform Supported Actions Facebook Post to Pages Instagram Publish posts & reels LinkedIn Publish to Company Pages Twitter/X Post text and media tweets TikTok Coming soon

Each platform has its own connector and publishing capabilities.

docs.title: 🚀 How to Connect
docs.text:
1. Go to Settings > Connectors
  2. Select your desired platform (e.g., Instagram)
  3. Click Connect and log in with your business account
  4. Grant necessary permissions (e.g., publish access)

Once connected, you’ll be able to select the platform when creating a new post or campaign.

Warning

Ensure you use a Business or Creator Account for Instagram and Facebook to enable publishing.

docs.title: ✍️ Creating & Scheduling Posts
docs.text:
1. Go to Campaigns > New Campaign or Posts > Create
  2. Select one or more channels: Facebook, LinkedIn, etc.
  3. Upload your media, write the caption, and tag assets
  4. Choose "Publish now" or "Schedule for later"
  5. Click Publish

You’ll receive a confirmation once the content is live or scheduled.

docs.title: 🛠️ Developer Guide
docs.text: This guide provides everything developers need to integrate Good Bards into their workflows — including authentication, API usage, webhooks, and best practices.

docs.title: 🔑 Authentication
docs.text: All API requests must be authenticated using a Bearer token.

docs.title: 🔐 How to Authenticate
docs.text:
1. Obtain your API token from Settings > API Keys
  2. Include it in the Authorization header:
Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_TOKEN

Explore: Authentication API

docs.title: 🧾 API Overview
docs.text:
The Good Bards REST API gives you programmatic access to:

  • 📁 Assets & versions
  • 📄 Campaigns & documents
  • 🗃️ Folders & organization
  • 📈 Analytics & reports
  • 🔄 Webhooks and automations

Explore: API Reference

docs.title: 📂 Example: Create a New Asset
docs.text:
POST /v1/{tenantId}/assets
Content-Type: application/json
Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_TOKEN

{
  "title": "New Product One-Pager",
  "folder": "/Q4/Launch",
  "assetType": "document",
  "content": {
    "blocks": [
      { "type": "text", "value": "Welcome to our launch!" }
    ]
  }
}

Explore: Assets API

docs.title: 📡 Webhooks
docs.text:
Webhooks let you receive real-time notifications for platform events like:

  • asset.published
  • campaign.created
  • asset.updated
  • webhook.failed

docs.title: 🔧 Setting Up Webhooks
docs.text:
1. Go to Settings > Webhooks
  2. Register your endpoint URL
  3. Choose the events you want to subscribe to

Webhook payloads are sent as POST requests with a JSON body and HMAC-SHA256 signature.

Explore: Webhooks API

docs.title: 🧠 Use Cases
docs.text:
• Sync assets with an external DAM or CMS
  • Trigger internal approval workflows
  • Monitor campaign publishing status
  • Build analytics dashboards with raw campaign data

docs.title: 🧩 Platform Integrations
docs.text:
Use Connectors to link your dev stack to Good Bards:

  • ✅ Google Drive, Dropbox
  • ✅ Slack, Discord
  • ✅ Webhooks & Custom APIs

Explore: Connectors

docs.title: 🚧 Rate Limits
docs.text:
• Standard Plan: 60 requests/minute
  • Pro Plan: 200 requests/minute
  • Burst: Limited to 5 concurrent API calls per token

For bulk operations, use batch endpoints or asynchronous processing.

docs.title: 🧪 Testing & Staging
docs.text:
A sandbox environment is available on request. It mirrors production behavior but doesn't affect real data or metrics.

Info

Contact support to request sandbox access or to rotate API keys.
